newsitem.title: USA: Premenos sees losses in next two quarters.
newsitem.headline: Premenos sees losses in next two quarters.

text.p: Premenos Technology Corp Wednesday said it expects to report losses in the current quarter and the subsequent quarter.

In a statement, the provider of electronic commerce solutions said it expects to post a loss in the first quarter ending in March of between $0.04 and $0.07 a share. Premenos did not specify a range for the second quarter.

According to First Call, analysts had expected the company to report a profit of $0.01 a share in the first quarter and $0.04 a share in the second quarter, up from $0.02 and $0.05 a share respectively a year ago.

Premenos said the loss reflects a review of the company's operations and sales and marketing strategy undertaken by new President and Chief Executie Timothy Dreisbach, who joined the company in January.

"The company's core business is solid, and we are very confident about our expanded product suite and emerging market demand," Dreisbach said. "However, management's plan for positive operating margins on an annual basis will not be achieved in the early quarters of this fiscal year."

"Since I arrived two months ago, the company has begun to refine its market strategy, with an increased emphasis on multi-product synergies, corresponding realignments of our marketing and sales channels and recasting of the executive management team," he said. "We are also absorbing significant headcount growth that occurred in the fourth quarter of 1996."
The company said its board of directors also approved the purchase of up to one million shares of common stock from time to time in the open market.
The company had 11,679,314 shares of common stock outstanding as of March 3.
